name: Spring Debugger
description:
The Spring Debugger plugin for IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate gives you instant insight into your Spring application while debugging. It brings Spring’s complex runtime behavior into focus by integrating seamlessly with IntelliJ IDEA. See how beans are wired, trace configuration values, inspect database connections, and monitor a transaction state—without leaving your IDE.

The Spring Debugger helps you understand what’s going on behind the scenes, so you can resolve issues faster, verify application state, and write high-quality, maintainable code.

Key features:

  • Application Context Insight

    • Context Visibility: Displays the state and details (name, type, scope) of instantiated Spring beans in the code editor, debugger tool window, and project view during active debug sessions.
    • Extended Watches: Enhances the standard Watches view with live runtime data for loaded Spring beans.
    • Direct Bean Method Invocation: Lets you access Spring bean methods and properties directly in the debugger’s expression evaluator.

  • Properties & Configuration

    • Actual Values Display: Shows the final resolved values of Spring configuration properties directly in the editor.
    • Property Evaluation in Debugger: Allows you to check property values at runtime using the debugger.
    • Value Source Tracking: Reveals where each property came from and its final value in the Watches view.
    • Loaded Configuration Files: Lists the configuration files that contributed to the current environment.

  • Data Access & Transactions

    • Active DB Connection Display: Automatically shows active database connections, including testcontainers, with no manual setup.
    • Transaction Status Display: Displays the current status of Spring-managed transactions inside the debugger tool window.
    • Entity State in Watches: Adds support for viewing JPA entity lifecycle states (e.g., managed, detached) directly in the Watches view.
